cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi (60 km) SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northward, then accelerating north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Big Bend, thereafter moving inland across southeast Georgia and South Carolina and emerging over or very near the North Carolina coast late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near the Aucilla River–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL northward to South Santee River SC (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from the Middle of Longboat Key northward to Indian Pass (hurricane) and associated storm-surge zones; none yet along the Atlantic coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then the coasts of Georgia, South Carolina, and southeastern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible (about a 1 in 5 chance) late Wednesday night through Thursday; risk of sustained 50-kt winds is very low (≈3%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft cannot be ruled out along the southeast NC coast but current guidance keeps the 2–4 ft watch area south of Cape Fear.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Wednesday night through Thursday, producing flash or urban flooding near port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat on outer rainbands; dangerous surf and rip currents.
